alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:04PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, northwestern Dutchess and southwestern Columbia Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 603 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Hurley, or near Saugerties, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Saugerties, Hurley, Woodstock, Livingston, Clermont, Red Hook, Ancram, Lake Katrine, West Hurley, Saugerties South, Claverack-Red Mills, Veteran, Germantown, Taghkanic, Tivoli, Centerville, Rolling Meadows, Kerleys Corners and Quarryville. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Western Ulster
